components.description:
A stylized white flower. Generally depicted as a rosette-shaped cherry blossom in pink or red outline, often with a white fill.

Apple, Microsoft, WhatsApp, and Facebook's designs feature Japanese characters roughly translating to very well done, used by teachers as a stamp for students who did exceptional work, often accompanied by a score in red.

Commonly used for Valentine’s Day, Mother’s Day, and other special occasions. May be more generally used to express such ideas as love, happiness, and beauty. Also used as a pink, white, or red accent color.

Not to be confused with ðŸŒ¸ Cherry Blossom and ðŸŒº Hibiscus, though their applications may overlap.

Apple's flower previously featured a red-outlined design, Google's an orange outline. Microsoft's flower was previously black and white, Samsung and Facebook's pink and white.
components.title: White Flower

title: White Flower

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Japanese school grade symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: An emoji symbol of a white flower, often a cherry blossom. The Apple artwork containsÂ Japanese text on the inside that translates to mean â€œW http://emojipedia.org/white-flower/
emoji_net_data.name: white flower

bn:00029966n: A water lily, genus Nymphaea, especially those of Egypt or India.
Egyptian water lily or Egyptian lotus may refer to.
White Egyptian lotus: water lily of Egypt to southeastern Africa; held sacred by the Egyptians
Nymphaea lotus, the tiger lotus, white lotus or Egyptian white water-lily, is a flowering plant of the family Nymphaeaceae.
Plant species (Nymphaea alba) from the water lily family (Nymphaeaceae) with white flowers, which grows in standing or slowly flowing waters in Europe, North Africa and the Middle East.

bn:00035378n: The reproductive structure of angiosperm plants, consisting of stamens and carpels surrounded by petals and sepals all borne on the receptacle.
A flower lacking sepals, petals, stamens, or carpels.
Flowers, sometimes known as blooms or blossoms, are the reproductive structures found in flowering plants.
A flower, sometimes known as a bloom or blossom, is the reproductive structure found in flowering plants.
Structure found in some plants (division Magnoliophyta / angiosperms) to support reproduction
A plant cultivated for its blooms or blossoms
